metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3277 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
An uncontrolled resource consumption flaw was found in openstack-neutron.This flaw allows a remote authenticated user to query a list of securitygroups for an invalid project. This issue creates resources that areunconstrained by the user's quota. If a malicious user were to submit asignificant number of requests, this could lead to a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3277` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

neutron-common - 2:22.0.0-0ubuntu1
neutron-dhcp-agent - 2:22.0.0-0ubuntu1
neutron-l3-agent - 2:22.0.0-0ubuntu1
neutron-linuxbridge-agent - 2:22.0.0-0ubuntu1
neutron-macvtap-agent - 2:22.0.0-0ubuntu1
neutron-metadata-agent - 2:22.0.0-0ubuntu1
neutron-metering-agent - 2:22.0.0-0ubuntu1
neutron-openvswitch-agent - 2:22.0.0-0ubuntu1
neutron-ovn-metadata-agent - 2:22.0.0-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-ml2 - 2:22.0.0-0ubuntu1
neutron-server - 2:22.0.0-0ubuntu1
neutron-sriov-agent - 2:22.0.0-0ubuntu1
python3-neutron - 2:22.0.0-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: neutron package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:22.0.0-0ubuntu1').
